alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Greene; Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 12:14PM EST until January 14 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Ulster County in east central New York... Northwestern Columbia County in east central New York... Greene County in east central New York... * Until 100 PM EST. * At 1214 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Catskill to near Woodridge, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 19 and 21B. Locations impacted include... Kingston, Ellenville, Catskill, Saugerties, Hunter, Hurley, Woodstock, New Baltimore, Coxsackie, Windham, Athens, Kinderhook, High Falls, Tillson, Napanoch, Woodland Valley Campground, Phoenicia, Mount Tremper, Olivebridge, and Kerhonkson. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. There is no safe place on a highway when a snow squall hits. Visibility and traction are immediately lost in whiteout conditions, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel or safely exit the highway before the snow squall arrives. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
